original_solution_mapping.L1: James lost 2 friends, so he has 20 - 2 = <<20-2=18>>18 friends left.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then he made 1 friend, James now has 18 + 1 = <<18+1=19>>19 friends.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2274.
    Returns: the number of friends James has left.
    """
    # L1
    initial_friends = 20 # James has 20 friends
    friends_lost = 2 # got into an argument with 2 of his friends
    friends_after_loss = initial_friends - friends_lost

    # L2
    friends_gained = 1 # he made one more friend
    final_friends = friends_after_loss + friends_gained

    # FA
    answer = final_friends
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: James lost {friends_lost} friends, so he has {initial_friends} - {friends_lost} = <<{initial_friends}-{friends_lost}={friends_after_loss}>>{friends_after_loss} friends left.
Then he made {friends_gained} friend, James now has {friends_after_loss} + {friends_gained} = <<{friends_after_loss}+{friends_gained}={final_friends}>>{final_friends} friends.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: James lost 2 friends, so he has 20 - 2 = <<20-2=10>>10 friends left.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Then he made 1 friend, James now has 10 + 1 = <<10+1=11>>11 friends.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '/' instead.
